value.title: Get started with model-driven apps in Power Apps
value.excerpt: Model-driven app design is an approach that focuses on quickly adding components to your apps. These components include dashboards, forms, views, and charts. With no code, or very little, you can make apps that are simple or very complex. Unlike in canvas app development, where the designer has total control over the app layout, much of the layout in model-driven apps is determined by the components you add. In other words, the emphasis is more on quickly viewing your business data and making decisions than on intricate app design.

value.title: Create a model-driven application in Power Apps
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to creating a model-driven app in Power Apps that uses Common Data Service.

topItems.title: Introduction to model-driven apps and Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to quickly build apps with little to no code? This module will focus on the building blocks of Common Data Service and model-driven apps. These key components will help you build quick business apps in your organization.

topItems.title: Get started with Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Common Data Service lets you securely store and manage data that's used by business applications. Standard and custom entities within Common Data Service provide a secure and cloud-based storage option for your data.

value.title: Microsoft Power Apps Tutorial for Beginners -  Build an App in 5 Minutes
value.excerpt: Learn how to use PowerApps to build a quick application to write data to an Excel Spreadsheet. In this quick tutorial, you'll be off to the races with Power Apps by building an app from data.  For more Power Apps and Power Platform training, please visit us: https://pragmaticworkstraining.com  - - -

value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 data​
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Data​

value.title: Get started using Common Data Service
value.excerpt: Do you want to learn how to build solutions that can leverage a standardized data structure and work with other solutions sharing the same data model?  Do you want to extend the standard model to support custom solutions? This learning path will explain the concepts behind and benefits of Common Data Service. Creating an environment, entities, fields and options sets are also discussed.

topItems.title: Create and manage environments in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: An environment is a space to store, manage, and share your organization's business data that is stored within an instance of a Common Data Service database.  You can set up one or many environments, depending on the needs of your organization. This module explores these environments and how you can use them with instances of Common Data Service databases.

topItems.title: Create and manage entities in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Common Data Service entities are similar to tables in a database. Every instance of a Common Data Service database includes a base set of entities that provide structure for data that is commonly used by business applications.

topItems.title: Create and manage fields within an entity in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to create new data fields or leverage exiting standardized fields for your business solutions?  This module will show you how to manage or create new fields within an entity in Common Data Service.

topItems.title: Working with option sets in Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to create standardized choice lists that you can use across all of your Power Apps?  This module will show you how to create new or use standard choice lists called option sets in Common Data Service.

value.title: Beginner Power Apps Topics by April Dunnam
value.excerpt: If you are new to Power Apps then this playlist is for you!  It's full of beginner level Power Apps topics to get you started building low code apps

This enables you to cut down on the number of screens and form controls by using the same screen to handle new item and existing item inputs.   For more PowerApps,

value.title: Introduction to Power Platform developer resources
value.excerpt: The goal of this module is to give a broad-scoped overview of the developer experience as it relates to the Power Platform.  It will cover a high-level introduction how the ecosystem is represented, with the intended audience being a software developer with limited experience in working with the Power Platform.

value.title: Author a basic formula to change properties in a Power Apps canvas app
value.excerpt: Want to enhance your Power Apps canvas app? You can use basic formulas to make changes to control properties.  This will include changing the format, position, simple calculations, and implementing conditional formatting.

value.title: Architect solutions for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Becoming a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform.

topItems.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

topItems.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

topItems.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

topItems.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer’s needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

value.title: Extending the Power Platform Common Data Service
value.excerpt: Getting started with extending the Power Platform Common Data Service can be overwhelming. This learning path looks at the tools and resources needed for extending the Power Platform. We'll start with looking at the SDKs, the extensibility model, and event framework. This learning path also covers when to use plug-ins. Configuration of plug-ins as well as registering and deploying plug-ins.

topItems.title: Introduction to Common Data Service for developers
topItems.excerpt: The goal of this module is to give an introductory overview of the Power Platform SDKs that are available from Microsoft via NuGet.

topItems.title: Extend plug-ins
topItems.excerpt: The purpose of this module is to provide an in-depth overview of plug-ins as it relates to Power Platform development. This module will review how and when plug-ins are implemented, how they are registered and deployed, and the various configuration options that are available during plug-in registration.

value.title: Introduction to Common Data Service for developers
value.excerpt: The goal of this module is to give an introductory overview of the Power Platform SDKs that are available from Microsoft via NuGet.

value.title: Work with external data in a Power Apps canvas app
value.excerpt: Do you need to connect an app to access data? Then this module is for you. It focuses on connecting your app to a data source.

value.title: Create and manage environments in Common Data Service
value.excerpt: An environment is a space to store, manage, and share your organization's business data that is stored within an instance of a Common Data Service database.  You can set up one or many environments, depending on the needs of your organization. This module explores these environments and how you can use them with instances of Common Data Service databases.

value.title: Master advanced techniques for Power Apps canvas apps
value.excerpt: Do you want to make sure your app is the best it can be? This learning path will help you use advanced formulas and perform custom updates. It will also focus on performance checks and testing.

topItems.title: Use imperative development techniques for canvas apps in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use imperative vs. declarative development.

topItems.title: Author an advanced formula that uses tables, records, and collections in a canvas app in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Do you have need for a complex formula in your app? This module can help you author that formula.

topItems.title: Perform custom updates in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: With some Power Apps canvas apps, a form is not the solution.  This module will focus on how to perform custom updates when your data is not in a form.

topItems.title: Complete testing and performance checks in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to test your app and improve it's performance? This module will help you understand how to test an app and improve performance.

value.title: Use advanced data options and connectors in Power Apps
value.excerpt: Do you want to improve the user's experience in your canvas app? Do you want to use custom connectors to connect to data? This learning path will help you do both things. It will also focus on working with data source limits.

topItems.title: Work with relational data in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to work with relational data in Power Apps canvas apps.

topItems.title: Work with data source limits (delegation limits) in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Delegate data with Power Apps.

topItems.title: Connecting to other data in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to connect to other data in Power Apps canvas app.

topItems.title: Use custom connectors in a Power Apps canvas app
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use custom connectors in a Power Apps canvas app.

value.title: Navigation in a canvas app in Power Apps
value.excerpt: App users can only navigate through the navigation options provided by an app developer, and this module is designed to help you build a good navigation experience for your canvas app.
